Uses of OperatingState in sndlib.core.problem
 

Fields in sndlib.core.problem declared as OperatingState
static OperatingState OperatingState.DEFAULT_BACKUP
          This is a special state used to simplify the definition of state-dependent routings especially in the case of 1+1 dedicated path protection.
static OperatingState OperatingState.NOS
          Constant specifying the normal operationg state, in which all links work properly.
 

Methods in sndlib.core.problem that return OperatingState
static OperatingState OperatingState.getInstance(java.lang.String stateName)
          Returns an appropriate operating state instance corresponding to the given name.
static OperatingState OperatingState.singleLinkFailureState(java.lang.String linkId)
          Constructs an operating state representing the failure of the link with the specified ID.
 

Methods in sndlib.core.problem that return types with arguments of type OperatingState
 java.util.Set<OperatingState> Problem.operatingStates()
          Returs the operating states of this problem.
 

Methods in sndlib.core.problem with parameters of type OperatingState
 DemandFlow SolvedProblem.getDemandFlow(Demand demand, OperatingState state)
          Returns the flow between the source and target node of the specified demand in the specified operating state.
 DemandLinkFlow SolvedProblem.getDemandLinkFlow(Demand demand, Link link, OperatingState state)
          Returns the flow on the specified link incurred by the given demand in the specified operating state.
 DemandPathFlow SolvedProblem.getDemandPathFlow(Demand demand, java.util.List<java.lang.String> path, OperatingState state)
          Returns the total flow on the given path which is incurred by the specified demand when the network is in the given state.
 LinkFlow SolvedProblem.getLinkFlow(Link link, OperatingState state)
          Returns the flow on the specified link in the specified operating state.
 DemandRouting SolvedProblem.getRouting(Demand demand, OperatingState state)
          Returns for the specified demand the routing, which is used when the network is in the given operating state.
 java.util.Collection<DemandRouting> SolvedProblem.routings(OperatingState state)
          Returns a Collection view of the demand routings which are used when the network is in the given state.
